title.narrative: Bosnia and Herzegovina Employment Support Program

description.narrative: The project development objective is to increase formal private sector employment among targeted groups of registered job seekers. The project will achieve this by financing a menu of active labor market programs, supporting strengthening of job intermediation, and by modernizing monitoring and evaluation practices of the public employment services.

participating-org.narrative: FBH (Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina) Ministry of Labor and Social Policy
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

title.narrative: Cost per job created by program after 12/24 months of completion of youth and disadvantaged people programs by type of program)

target.value: Decreased cost or increased impact defined as serving a larger number of vulnerable beneficiaries

title.narrative: Annual report that monitors Programs by various subgroups (age, gender, long-term unemployed, branch office) and provides recommendations on how to improve either targeting or design of Programs
Number of redesigned Programs based on annual report recommendations in order to increase cost-effectiveness
Client satisfaction of job seekers in need of PES support improves over time or stays at high level
Percent of ALMP beneficiaries who remain employed as a result of participation in ALMPs 12 /24 months after completion of program relative to employment status of control group
Number of registered jobseekers placed in jobs through wage subsidy ALMP programs
Number of registered jobseekers in need of PES support de-registering from unemployment registry because they found a formal job
